page.title: 10Farthing Down
page.content: Farthing Down is a {hilly area}, 147 metres above sea level. It is found between Coulsdon and Chipstead.Farthing Down is used as a {public open space} by local people of all ages.The Down is used for such activities as birdwatching, jogging, horse riding, picnics,dog walking and nature study. There is a cafe which sells drinks and sweets. Farthing Down is also of {archaeological interest}, as it has a Saxon Cemetery. Celtic field patterns have been found there too, and their remains can still be seen today. Part of the Downs has been set aside as a {Nature Trail}. When we followed the trail, we saw an ancient hedgerow which we dated back to Saxon times and an area of beech trees called'The Folly'.We saw {many birds}, such as magpies, greenfinches, collared doves,a kestrel, swifts and skylarks.
